title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Skagit County Sheriff (washington))

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Skagit County Sheriff (washington))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Your Skagit County, WA public records request #26-229 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Skagit County, WA ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-229 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to Skagit County Records Department. Someone from our records team will respond as required by RCW 42.56.520, within five business days. ln calculating the five business days, the following are not counted: the day the county receives the request, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. RCW 1.12.040. See also WAC 44-14-03006. lf the request is received by the County after County business hours. the request shall be deemed to have been received by the county on the next business day. A response may be (a) providing the records, (b) providing a link to records available online, (c) providing a reasonable estimated date of when the records will be available, (d) requesting clarification, or (e) denial of the request. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me at 360-416-1152, or by email at pherman@co.skagit.wa.us. Sincerely, Pamela Herman Certified Public Records Officer, Central Services Skagit County 360-416-1152 Public Records Act (PRA) Notice. Any information, including certain personal information, submitted to the County by e-mail or other method may be subject to disclosure as a public record under RCW chapter 42.56.  As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Skagit County, WA portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Skagit County, WA through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Skagit County, WA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Your Onslow County, NC public records request #26-127 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Onslow County, NC ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-127 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to Onslow County Government. It has been received and forwarded to the appropriate department for processing. Please note that depending on the size and scope of your request, staff availability, and legal obligation to protect confidential information, processing may take up to or more than 7 business days. If the requested information is available online, a link will be provided. In accordance with County policy, the County is not required to create new records or provide records in a format it does not currently maintain. Requests involving personnel matters must be reviewed by the County Attorney and may take additional time. For more details, please refer to our Public Records Request Policy. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Onslow County, NC.
